body.p: Couchbase Server 4.0 Release Candidate (also referred to as 4.0 RC) is released in Aug 2015.

section.title: Supported platforms
section.p: Couchbase Server 4.0 RC is available on various Linux systems, Mac OS, and Windows.

p.b: This release cannot be used for production deployments.

body.section:
Known limitations and issues This section lists the limitation and known issues in this release.
Limitations
Couchbase Server 4.0 RC is not intended for production deployments.
Any performance measurements that you do on the 4.0 RC version will not be representative of the general availability (GA) version of the product.
Issues
3-5x increase in index size when rebalancing with views.
DCP consumer is delayed when consuming large mutations ~ 20MB.
Rebalance progress is incorrectly captured when using delta node recovery.

p.b: Ports that need to be open on firewalls

section.p:
There are several new network ports that need to be open on firewalls when upgrading from an earlier version of Couchbase Server. These ports are:
9100 Internal index admin port
9101 Internal index scan port
9102 Internal index HTTP port
9103 Internal index build port
9104 Internal index build port
9105 Internal index maintenance
9998 Internal REST port

section.title: Fixed issues
section.p: The following issues are fixed in Couchbase Server 4.0 RC release:

row.entry: XDCR to remote buckets would continue even after the cluster reference was deleted.
The query engine rejected the correct name of a prepared statement and encoded plan.
Elasticsearch plugin was not working due to XDCR v1 compatibility issue.
Server authentication logs were flooded with failure messages if LDAP was enabled.
The CREATE INDEX request was hanging.
During initial cluster setup or when a node was added, the data, index, and query services were not enabled by default.
Secondary index compaction caused degradation in write throughput.
Node failed to start and a “metadata corruption” error was thrown.
A node could not join a cluster with less RAM than “cluster quota” even though it was not adding the data service.
UI - Index: Connection to Couchbase Server was lost.
An error was thrown when adding nodes to the Couchbase cluster and performing a swap rebalance.
CBQ: Creating a primary index with a view did not return on cbq even after the index was reported online from the system:indexes.
Index service failed to recover when a data node went down and was followed by a rebalance.
2i triggered a core dump with the following error "panic: runtime error: index out of range".
[Windows 64-bit]: After a few failover or rebalance tests, the nodes could not be accessed.
The /controller/addNode threw an error (400) "Unexpected server error, request logged".
The projector generated a core file when the secondary index was not used.
[Windows 64-bit]: Errors occurred while performing rebalance operation with mutations in parallel.
[Windows 64-bit]: memcached crashed when creating a default bucket with a node that had data, index and query on the same node.
Memcached crashed due to the segmentation fault during a swap rebalance.
[Windows 64-bit]: Memcached failed to start on some Windows systems.
[Windows 64-bit]: View Indexes in the pending state returned an error: "System database error: Failed to load indexes."
[Windows 64-bit]: The primary GSI index on a bucket could not be created.
Build index request failed with a timeout.
The integration test for test_flush_bucket_and_query failed with an error: "Fails to create index. There is no available index service."
[Windows 64-bit]: Views did not return all items.
Duplicate entries for indexes were observed in the UI.
There were multiple bucket refreshes per query.
When Indexes were online and contained no values, the queries returned blank results.
Rebalance add node failed with an error: "missing_partition,803".
In a multi-node scenario, a query with != used the previously defined where clause index but failed to get the expected results.
The Create Index operation did not finish ~ 9 minutes after failover of the 2 data nodes in a cluster. Data loss with rollback was observed.

[Windows 64-bit]: Creating a view my_index0 failed and reported the following: "cause: error starting a view request at dial tcp 127.0.0.1:8092. ConnectEx tcp: No connection could be made because the target machine actively refused it: ', u'code': 13000".
[Windows 64-bit] The drop index operation failed with an error "View Index not found on my_non_index".
UI: Outbound replication panels (from multiple replications) constantly kept swapping places.
DCP backfill failed to read expected data.
Rebalance operation failed if bucket replication was in mixed DCP/TAP state.
Unicode collation in views on Couchstore was incorrect.
Starting or stopping Couchbase Server on CentOS 6.6 failed.
When the indexing key was large, the view failed to index and prevented other views in the same design document from being processed.
